config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration _clock is used in the publisher method to determine which type of publisher to instantiate based on the presence of _remoteServerIpAddress. If _remoteServerIpAddress is not null, a ClientPublisher is created with the specified server IP address and port. Otherwise, a CentralPublisher is created with the current clock and journal.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the _clock configuration is dependent on the conditions specified in the publisher method. If _remoteServerIpAddress is frequently changing or being updated, the configuration may be triggered more often.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the _clock configuration option on the system is related to the type of publisher instantiated. If a ClientPublisher is created, it may involve network communication and connection establishment with the remote server. On the other hand, if a CentralPublisher is created, it may involve local clock and journal operations.
